text: also, the hotel would be advised to forget the waffles, chocolate and water freebies and provide tea and coffee making facilities.
and curtains could do with a splash of colour.
the public areas are those you would expect from a 2-3 star hotel - all again in need of a major updating.
the comforter, drapes and furniture were in need of replacement.
the carpets and furniture are in need of renewal.
the breakfastbuffet was comprehensive, and could be supplemented by made-to-order eggs, pancakes, omelets, or french toast.
please refrain from using your renovation as an excuse for doing such a lousy job and consider lowering your rating for what it's worth, 2* maybe 3 and nothing more.
if they could improve the service, this would be a top hotel even on a world-level standard.
in-room tea and coffee facilities would be a bonus..
and any other business owner would agree that some sort of action should be taken by the owner of this hotel for his guests.
for the price and area they should include breakfast at least.
keep in mind that the walls at this hotel are very thin.
one suggestion to the hotel - sounds like being turned away for not having a room available has happened frequently in the past.
they need to watch those food temperatures
the lobby could use a little work as well.
please be aware though there was no indication that breakfast was not included
please be advised that there are steep stairs leading in to this hotel so it would not be suitable for anyone with walking difficulties
they should simply put whirlpool jets in it and accept the fact that it is nothing more than a big bathtub.
mattress in need of replacement or rotation - i felt i would slide off the bed because the mattress leaned towards the telephone.
there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room which should really be standard in a 4 star hotel.
but for a 5-star luxury hotel, it would be nice if they would drop off a bottle of water every day.
spa really need to be cleaned (avoid the hammam).
i would suggest that hotel langlois paint  furnish the attic so that it measures up to the rest of their facility.
room needs better electricity plugs
Room was big, bath was lovely, but watch out for the tile floor after you shower.
Desk staff needs to go to a Waldorf class on manners.
Chair upholstery needs to be cleaned.
With the highest breakfast prices we've ever seen, it would have been nice to have in-room beverage stations/coffee makers like one usually finds in Westins.
Rooms needed upgrading badly (and our view was of the roof!) and a good clean!
My take on it is that the sewer system put in by the GDR needs to be replaced.
Another comfortable chair in the room, there's one, would be a plus We only ate one breakfast here because we slept in, but its a bit expensive.
but most bathrooms are in urgent need of remodelling (the existing ones are dating back to the 60s!).
The rooms need a re-do.
but the bathroom was tired and in need of refurbishment.
Whilst the room was indeed large, clean and functional it lacked the finishing touches that one expects from 5-star accommodation.
The room - on the executive floor - could have used a good dusting.
but eventually need renovating.
The hotel is very tired and is in desperate need of a refurb.

When we booked the room the description on the website said it came with a separate seating area, despite raising the issue with reception we were basically told this was not so , I guess someone needs to amend the website.
but the whole place is in serious need of a refurbishment.
This hotel is badly in need of a manager who knows what is going on in the place.

Negatives: Bed (if you are used to Sofitel beds from around there world don't stay here), bedding (old polyester), house keeping (on both morning the room was not properly cleaned and coffee and toiletry supplies were not replenished; the room was also not very clean with huge stains on the curtains), in room equipment (if you love 70s retro you will love the TV in the room).
This hotel should not be allowed to call itself a Sofitel as the rooms are well below standard, the staff however are right up there.
I do wish that the staff were more accomodating.
and they should send the staff on a training course in customer relations.
I really advice the hotel
but some of the staff behind reception need a few lessons in customer service (ie.
a smile or even some acknowledgment when handing in keys wouldn't go amiss).
The hotel should give a password out to guests that check-in or at least program a time-out to avoid this frustrating situation.
Beware: some rooms are very small and outdated
The point is - don't advertise the service if there are caveats that go with it.
Parking at $30 per day is an outrage but possibly standard for downtown (you can find street parking on the weekend to save a few dollars).
although the marble in the bathrooms could have used a thorough cleaning as they had dirt and rust stains.
Parking was expensive and there was no elevator in the parkade so if you have any mobility problems you need to use the valet parking.
Rooms do not appear to have any functioning heating or built in fan/cooler/heaters which is a bit of a drawback depending on when you visit.
and I've got to say that it was in desperate need of an update (and I'm not picky).
What respectable hotel, especially one with such expensive rooms, would have the gall to also charge lodging for their guests' cars?
For what we paid for those rooms, they should have been courteous enough not to ream us on parking.

Food in over cooked, at least the water in cafe was drinkable, and don't be fooled by there complimentary newspaper, if you read the sticker the put on it you will see that you will be charged for it to $$$$.
Treadmills were in very bad need of repair.
Meaning, dont expect your family of four to be comfortable in one room.
So if you are checking in and they allocate room 1238, make sure you have your own mirror.
Yay After 2 hours of dealing with the floor manager, Matthew Sims,If you ever have to deal with this man, go above him.
The breakfast consisted of doughnuts and muffins, if you were quick enough.
Be careful not to wander into attic late at night though as carpet is very damp.
Cleanliness is not a priority in this area - so go with that in mind.
The room was fine, but be forewarned, the neighboring Hilton is building a high-rise time share building right next to the Ilikai , Diamond Head side.
I hope they update their website to advise of this.
dont trust the staff here
So dont trust the staff, and be prepared for them to try it on and cause problems.
The hotel is very dated and in need of a LOT of work.
The front desk staff could use a really good lesson on manners, professionalism, and genuine hospitality.
They could use a little polishing up and professional conversational skills.
The pool area is nice but the pool itself could use a good scrub down.
Could be a real gem since it is an older property/building and could get some of its original character back with some renovating, and better front desk staff.

Things to bring ,aside from the obvious, - Antibacterial hand soap for your room, spray air freshner, an alarm clock ,or just a clock as they do no have them in any of the rooms,, Cortizone ,for heat rashes,, Benadryl ,to stop the itching from heat rash...lol,, face cloths ,we got these one day and never saw them again,.
Quiet for the most part, the room was adequate but could use some minor remodeling.
Room serviceRoom service needs management.
Our first room had a small kitchenette, the second did not -- here, a micro wave and a small fridge would have been welcome.
The only thing that would be better would be Oceanview.
The hotel itself was interesting since it is round, the staff were polite but the hotel itself is understaffed.
The price was ok but after staying- I would expect that the rates should be lowered.
Beware - If paying the buffet breakfast was poor value, Ok for cereals and fruit,poor quality cooked breakfast.
If you can get the rate this is a great stopover and the staff have a lot of nice touches like getting us some water for the cab ride back to the airport.
The manager should have been promoted long ago,-I will never again meet such a Man who was so happy to help and rectify any problems- he was wonderful.
I understand things happen, an apology would have been nice.
Room layout good - but would recommend some barrier to stop water from the shower getting the carpet wet
I was happy to get it, but a working minibar would have been preferable.
Bigger rooms , bar at ground floor, bigger reception, but then it wouldnt be the hotel that it is .
The hotel decor is very tasteful and trendy, and while the wallpaper may need a tiny bit of work here and there, as has been mentioned before, its really not a big deal.
Rooms are clean and nice, but bear in mind you just pay for lodging, service does not seem to be included.
La Luna could dampen this noise significantly if they were to seal the door so that it fits better in the door frame.
They either need to rewrite the policy on the amount of time a cart can be kept by guests or put DVD players in all rooms.
I think guests should get to park for free.
